intro: Zootrophion leonii, commonly known as the Leon's zootrophion, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Zootrophion leonii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
